jewellgm wrote:

>I'm afraid I probably just caused a bit more confusion.  To clarify:  
>I am already able to specify the name of the configuration file from 
>the command line if I call the class directly.  It's from within the 
>ant framework that I'm having these difficulties.  I can use 
>the "java" task to execute the class, but then I don't get the XML 
>(and then HTML) reports.  That is what is making me think the 
>environment variable may be the only way to go....
>  
>
To pass a property from Ant, you probably want to use a
<sysproperty> element nested in your <junit> task element.

Louis Tribble
